text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today we are gonna be making something I got
so many requests for. Today I am

gonna be making Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles!
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles!

We’re gonna be making Teenage mutant Ninja
Turtle Cake Pops!
So let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 1 red velvet
cake, I’ve already pre-baked it,

you just use your favorite red cake recipe.
Also 2 sh-ticks of cream cheese,

these are 8 ounces, so you’ll need 16 ounces
total, 1 big mixing bowl, lollipop

sh-ticks, chocolate melts, you’ll need green
chocolate melts and white chocolate melts.

I also have a little bit of oil based yellow
food coloring dye, and that’s to make

our white chocolate melts kind of a tan, yellowish
color. Because I couldn’t find
yellow at the stores… So just make ‘em!

You also need frosting, we have white frosting
and red frosting, and, a foam block.

This thing’s pretty handy, it’s to stick
the cake pops in.

We also have little candy eyeballs, and, fondant
in 4 colors, red, purple, blue and

orange for all of the Teenage Mutant Ninja
Turtles.
Let’s put it all together!

This recipe is super easy, I made it before
on the social media cake pops, so if you

want to check out that video it’s a little
bit more in-depth, but I still wanted to

show you how to do it. So you’re just gonna
take a a big cutting knife, cut your cake

into sections, kinda 4. Take 2 pieces, put
it over the big bowl and rub them together,

makes a bunch of crumbs. This is called crumbing
your cake. Oh, oh, oh!

Gets really messy, you can get your hands
in there.

Once your cake’s all crumbed, you’re gonna
add your 2 sh-ticks of cream cheese.

There’s 1, I've let them sit out a little so
that they’re room temperature. Makes them

easier to work with, you don’t have to,
just a little easier.

So they’re in here, and this is where you
get your hands messy again.
Uh, yeah!

Once you’ve mixed in all your cream cheese,
we’re just gonna roll,

our little cake balls, and put them on top
of this cookie sheet, I lined it with

a piece of wax paper so that they won’t stick,
and so you just take a little bit,

to be the size of like a golf ball, and you
don’t need to make them perfect because

we’re gonna put them in the freezer and
then after they set we’ll re-roll them so

that they’re really smooth, so just get
the size right.

So I’m making half of them little circle balls
and then the other half I’m gonna roll

it into a ball, and then flatten it, just
a little bit. Because it’s

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, they love Pizza,
So I’m gonna make pizza cake pops
as well. I decided that would be cool!

Once you got all your little cake balls rolled,
we’re gonna put them in the freezer for

about 30 minutes, and there’s a lot of extra,
that’s OK! You can make a bunch of ‘em!

OK, we’ll go put ‘em in for 30 minutes,
and then we’ll go heat up the chocoalte
and put in the lollipop sticks!
Nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee, nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee,
nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee!

I just took the cake balls out of the freezer,
and melted some chocolate. I’ve got my

green chocolate, and this was the white chocolate
that I added a little bit of food
coloring to, so it looks like yellow, tan-ish.

What you’re gonna do is pick up a cake ball,
and you’ll see how it’s kinda lumpy.

This is where you just roll it, just so much easier
to work with now because

they aren’t as sticky! They’ve been sitting
in the freezer.

And I’ll show you the difference, so here’s
after, and here’s before.

Now what you’re gonna do is take 1 of your
lollipop sticks,

and I’m gonna dip it in green, take your
cake ball, stick it in, try to put the

lollipop stick about 1/2 way through, and
for the pizza 1, that’s a little bit flat,

again we’re just gonna smooth it, then you’re
gonna take your little pizza pie

cake ball, dip your stick in the yellow, and
again, stick it in about 1/2 way,

Now what you’re gonna do is take your cake
pop and your green chocolate, and what

I like to do is just put it here, and spin
it around slowly.

Then pick it up, and on the side of the bowl,
just tap-tap-tap-tap-tap,
jiggle-jiggle-jiggle, to get off the excess.

That’s good, alright, then we’re gonna
stick it in the foam block.

And now we’re gonna do the same thing to
our little pizza pie pop!
We're gonna put it in the yellow chocolate.

This time we’re gonna do 1 side, try to
do 1/2 way and then I like to flip it over.

And you can make as many as you’d want so
god that to the rest of the cake pops!

Now that we’ve got our cake pops made, we
are gonna make our Teenage Mutant
Ninja Turtle ninja masks!
Da-na-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee-nee, Na-na OH! Ha-ha!

To decorate our little cake pops we have 4
different colors of fondant, we have

orange, red, purple and blue. And it’s for
our little Ninja Turtle ninja masks.
For Michelangelo, Raphael, Donatello and Leonardo!

OK, so I’ve already cut the strips right
hero you can see what they’re gonna look like

for their little masks, and I’m gonna show
you how to roll them out and
how to make these!

So you’re gonna take a little piece of fondant,
take a rolling pin, just roll it out!

Then you’re just gonna take a sharp cutting
knife, just kind of eyeball it, however
thick you’d like your masks to be.

And we’re gonna be making where the mask
ties, the little thing, so we’re just gonna

cut out little triangles out of the excess
fondant.

And make 1 a little bit smaller, and I’m
gonna make 1 a little bit bigger.
Then stick the smaller 1 on top of the bigger 1.

So that when it’s assembled it will look
like that with his little eyeballs.

Now we’ve got our little ninja masks on
top of our Ninja Turtles, eragh-ew!!

And now we’re just gonna use frosting to
decorate their little mouths and frosting to

make our pizzas look all cheesy and marinara
sauce-y and little pepperoni!

Ta-da! Here are our Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle
Cake Pops!

And the little pepperoni pizza cake pops,
they’re so cute!
Thanks for suggesting it, these are awesome!

These little pizzas are making me so hungry!
They look like bagel bites!

And I think I’m gonna go order pizza right
now! And, if you have any other suggestions

for any other Nerdy Nummies, please let me
know, leave me a comment down below and I
will do my best to make it happen!
OK, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na… Na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na!
Na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na! Na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na!
Nunchuck skills!
